intro: Wulfenia wyomingensis, commonly known as the Wyoming wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Polemoniaceae, which includes several showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Wulfenia wyomingensis is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in high elevation areas.
